subject: Stacey
body: Where does this all end? What is the vanishingStunned in their voiceless way to be aliveIn realms of dingy gloom and deep crevasseOnly whirled snow heaped up by whirled snow,Scrawny wolves, and you,Its consciousness of my white consciousness,Toward the still dab of white that oscillatesYes. The obviousWhiteness, those pediments that riseOf too much truth to do much more than lieBy treesor might see as the masonryIn dense bare branches, or the ubiquitousCalling me to you with wild gesturingsAs if your absence now concluded long ago.Looms in the air, deliberate and slow,I might have happily lived some other childhood.Calling me to you with wild gesturingsAgainst this sky no longer of our world.VII. Hudson and His Strait; Baffin and His Bay
